DomainDataElements.product_categories_and_types: How should home goods products be categorized (e.g. pillows, mattresses, smart beds, accessories) for browsing and organization?
DomainDataElements.product_core_attributes: Which core data fields are required for each product (e.g., SKU, category, price, stock, variations like size/color)?
DomainDataElements.product_core_fields: Which product fields are required (e.g., name, price, description, SKU, stock quantity, category, images) to support browsing and cart operations?
DomainDataElements.product_data_attributes: Which core product data attributes must be supported in the system (e.g. SKU, category, price, inventory, region, time period)?
DomainDataElements.product_data_fields: Which product data fields (e.g., name, description, price, images, variants) should be displayed and managed on the website?
DomainDataElements.product_data_structure: What key fields should each product contain (e.g. title, description, price, attributes/specs, images, inventory, merchant info)?
DomainDataElements.product_information_fields: Which information fields are needed for each webshop product (e.g. title, description, price, age range, images, stock status)?
DomainDataElements.product_master_data_scope: Which specific fields should product master data, store products, prices, inventory, store lists, and store details include (e.g. name, SKU, description, location, stock levels)?
DomainDataElements.product_or_service_summary_level: How detailed should the concise introduction to products or services be (e.g. one-line summaries, short sections, or links to detailed pages)?
DomainDataElements.project_data_fields: What data fields should be stored for each project (e.g. title, abstract, PI, team members, labs, start/end dates, funding source, budget)?
DomainDataElements.project_metadata_fields: What project information should be displayed for each PHP project (e.g., name, version, description, features, install instructions, license)?
DomainDataElements.property_and_owner_data_elements: Which key data elements need to be stored for properties and owners (e.g. building, unit, area, owner contact, fee standards)?
DomainDataElements.query_result_structure: What structure and metadata should be shown for query results (e.g., column types, row count, execution time)?
DomainDataElements.question_and_answer_structure: What types of test questions do you need to support (e.g. multiple choice, true/false, short answer) and how should correct answers be represented?
DomainDataElements.recognized_fields_scope: Beyond material type, brand, supplier, inspection institution and inspection result, what additional data fields from the reports should the system recognize and store (e.g. report number, date, batch number)?
DomainDataElements.recommendation_criteria: On what basis should recommendations be generated (e.g., past user behavior, content similarity, popularity, sentiment, language preferences)?
DomainDataElements.referral_reward_structure: How should referral rewards be structured and represented (e.g. percentage of referred user’s investment, fixed bonus in BTC, tiers or limits)?
DomainDataElements.repair_and_activity_data_elements: Which fields are required for repair records and owner activities (e.g. repair status, assigned staff, activity time and location, participant list)?
DomainDataElements.repository_metadata_fields: Which repository-related fields should be stored in the NoSQL database (e.g., file paths, commit hashes, authors, timestamps)?
DomainDataElements.representative_information_fields: Which specific data fields should be shown for each representative (e.g. name, title, constituency, party, contact info, term, responsibilities)?
DomainDataElements.reservation_slot_attributes: Which details should be shown for visit reservation slots (e.g. date, time range, capacity, remaining availability)?
DomainDataElements.resource_core_fields: Beyond name, type, and description, which additional fields should each resource include (e.g. owner, department, sensitivity level, validity period)?
DomainDataElements.resource_metadata_fields: What metadata fields should be stored for each resource file (e.g. title, description, category, tags, version, uploader, upload date)?
DomainDataElements.reward_description_fields: What reward-related information should be displayed (e.g. reward type, quantity, rarity, claim conditions, expiry)?
DomainDataElements.routing_rule_domain_fields: Which specific data elements should each routing rule contain (e.g., rule name, match conditions, source, destination, protocol, priority, enabled flag, description)?
DomainDataElements.row_count_definition: Should the exported data quantity represent total rows in the table or rows after applying the specified conditions?
DomainDataElements.satellite_iot_data_model: What core fields and relationships should be defined for satellite IoT data, devices, and ground stations (e.g. telemetry types, units, metadata)?
DomainDataElements.scenic_spot_data_fields: What specific data fields should be stored for each scenic spot (e.g., name, description, location, opening hours, ticket price, images)?
DomainDataElements.script_metadata_fields: Which metadata fields about each script should be displayed (e.g., name, description, repository path, last run time, version, author)?
DomainDataElements.security_alert_types: What types of security alerts should be supported (e.g., geofence breach, no-movement, man-down, device offline) and what key data should each alert record?
DomainDataElements.self_inspection_report_fields: Which data elements should a self-inspection report capture (e.g. checklist items, findings, severity, recommendations, deadlines)?
DomainDataElements.sensitive_word_handling_rules: Should sensitive words and blacklist matches block publishing, trigger warnings for editors, auto-replace content, or route items to manual review?
DomainDataElements.service_attributes: Which attributes should each service record include (e.g. category, base price, estimated duration, required skills, on-site coverage, provider type)?
DomainDataElements.set_and_fragment_attributes: What information should be stored and shown for sets and fragments (e.g., name, rarity, required fragment count, progress)?
DomainDataElements.shipping_data_elements: Which shipping-related data elements are needed (e.g. logistics company, tracking code, shipped time, delivery time)?
DomainDataElements.shopping_product_and_order_data: Which core fields are needed for store products and orders (e.g. price, stock, SKU, delivery address, order status)?
DomainDataElements.soft_pull_report_fields: Which specific data fields from the soft pull reports should be displayed for the customer?
DomainDataElements.stock_universe_scope: Which markets or stock universes should be available for mock trading (e.g. US equities only, multiple exchanges)?
DomainDataElements.store_information_fields: What store-related information should be stored and shown (e.g., store name, description, contact info, logo, status)?
DomainDataElements.subject_taxonomy: Which subjects and, if needed, subtopics should be defined for organizing the test questions?
DomainDataElements.summary_metadata_elements: Which metadata should be stored and shown with each summary (e.g., source platform, topic labels, number of original posts, time window, engagement metrics)?
DomainDataElements.supervision_review_fields: What structured fields should be recorded during supervision and inspection (e.g. review comments, decision, required rectification actions)?
DomainDataElements.supported_citation_source_types: Which types of sources should the citation formatting support and test in preview (e.g. books, articles, websites, reports)?
DomainDataElements.supported_data_sources: Which types of external systems or data sources should users be able to integrate with the platform (e.g. databases, APIs, files, cloud services)?
DomainDataElements.supported_data_types: Besides strings, hash tables, lists, sets, and sorted sets, do you need to support any additional data types now or in the future?
DomainDataElements.supported_database_types: Which types of databases should the client support (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle)?
DomainDataElements.supported_fiat_currencies: Which real-world currencies should be supported when recharging or withdrawing through Alipay or WeChat?
DomainDataElements.supported_locales: Which languages and regional locales should be supported by the website's internationalization and localization features?
DomainDataElements.supported_sql_features: Which SQL features must be supported in queries and editing (e.g. multiple tables, joins, transactions, views, indexes)?
DomainDataElements.table_structure_details: Which table structure details should be shown (e.g. columns, data types, nullability, indexes, constraints, foreign keys)?
DomainDataElements.task_list_item_fields: Which data elements should each task list item include (e.g. objective text, current progress, total required, status, time remaining)?
DomainDataElements.task_record_structure: What standard fields should be stored for each task (type, root cause, actions taken, spare parts used, labor time, results, confirmations)?
DomainDataElements.task_vs_event_structure: Should tasks be distinct from schedule events with their own fields and statuses (e.g. to-do items with completion state) or treated as the same type of item?
DomainDataElements.theme_color_data_structure: What theme color attributes (e.g., primary, secondary, accent, text colors) need to be stored and displayed for each corporate theme configuration?
DomainDataElements.ticket_and_scenic_area_attributes: Which attributes should be defined for scenic areas and ticket types (e.g. price, validity period, time slot, usage rules, age categories)?
DomainDataElements.todo_item_data_fields: Which data elements should a to-do item display to make it actionable (e.g. related resource, applicant, due date, priority)?
DomainDataElements.toy_attributes: Which attributes should each toy include besides age, price, and brand (e.g. name, category, description, images, stock status)?
DomainDataElements.tracked_events_granularity: What level of granularity do you need for tracked events (e.g. per app open/close, per file read/write, per camera/microphone session start/end)?
DomainDataElements.transaction_history_attributes: What data fields should be included in historical transaction values (e.g. date, sale price, quantity, buyer anonymization)?
DomainDataElements.transaction_status_states: Which status values should transactions have (e.g. pending, completed, failed, cancelled, under_review)?
DomainDataElements.update_status_definition: How should update status be represented (e.g., ongoing, completed, paused, last updated date)?
DomainDataElements.user_account_fields: What core fields are needed for user accounts (e.g. name, username, contact info, department, role, permissions)?
DomainDataElements.user_identity_data: Which user identity attributes are required for real-name authentication and ongoing account management (e.g. legal name, ID number, address, contact info, bank or card details)?
DomainDataElements.user_information_fields: Which user data fields should be managed in the system (e.g. name, contact details, addresses, order history, preferences)?
DomainDataElements.user_profile_attributes: Which fields should user profiles include (e.g. name, avatar, phone, address, ID verification status, service areas, skills)?
DomainDataElements.user_profile_data_fields: What core data fields should be stored for tourists and administrators (e.g., full name, email, phone, role, preferences)?
DomainDataElements.user_profile_fields: Which user profile details, if any, do you need to store (e.g. nickname, contact info, play history, balance)?
DomainDataElements.vehicle_additional_details: Do you need any additional vehicle details beyond VIN, make, model, year, and mileage displayed on the page?
DomainDataElements.video_metadata_fields: What metadata fields should be editable for each video (e.g. title, description, tags, thumbnail, duration)?
DomainDataElements.video_metadata_model: Which metadata fields should each video store for categorization, tagging, and SEO (e.g., title, description, tags, category, language, SEO slug)?
DomainDataElements.virtual_currency_exchange_rate: What exchange rate should apply between real currency and knowledge coins for both recharge and withdrawal?
DomainDataElements.voucher_data_elements: Which key data fields should each group purchase voucher contain (e.g. code, product, buyer info, purchase date, expiry date, status, usage time)?
DomainDataElements.website_core_attributes: What core attributes should be stored for each website (e.g., domain, document root, runtime/PHP version, associated database, disk quota)?
DomainDataElements.website_entity_attributes: Which attributes should be stored for each website (e.g. URL, verification status, last checked time, sitemap URL, diagnostics summary)?

FileAndMediaContent.application_download_channels: Should the web app present multiple download options (e.g. App Store, Google Play, direct APK) for the application?
FileAndMediaContent.ar_assets_and_effects: Which AR media assets are needed for the virtual scene and monsters (e.g. 3D models, animations, hit effects, environment overlays)?

FileAndMediaContent.comic_image_quality: What image quality and formats should be used for comic pages (e.g., resolution targets, compression, support for webp/jpg/png)?

FileAndMediaContent.content_types_to_support: Which types of remote web content should the proxy prioritize supporting correctly (e.g., HTML only, images, video/audio streams, downloads)?
FileAndMediaContent.displayed_data_types: What types of data or content should be displayed on the pages (e.g., lists, tables, cards) for users to view?
FileAndMediaContent.downloadable_exhibition_materials: What types of exhibition materials should be available for download or viewing (e.g. brochures, floor plans, PDFs, images, videos)?
FileAndMediaContent.embedded_h5_content_scope: What types of content should the embedded H5 pages present (e.g., static informational content, interactive activity flows, blog articles, media elements)?

FileAndMediaContent.file_display_format: Should customer-uploaded files be shown as a simple list of file links, as thumbnails/previews, or both?
FileAndMediaContent.icon_metadata_structure: What metadata should be stored for each icon (e.g. name, tags, category, author, platform, color variants)?
FileAndMediaContent.inclusion_of_original_media: Do you need to display or embed original media (images, videos, links) from the source posts within the summaries or detail views?
FileAndMediaContent.learning_media_types: What types of media should be supported for online dance learning materials (e.g. instructional videos only, plus PDFs, images, or audio)?
FileAndMediaContent.media_reuse_across_templates: Should uploaded media be stored in a shared library so it can be reused across multiple templates and messages?
FileAndMediaContent.news_content_format: What formats should news content support (e.g., text articles only, plus images, attachments, and embedded videos)?
FileAndMediaContent.product_images: Do you need product images or other media for each product listing?

FileAndMediaContent.product_media_guidelines: Should there be standards for product media content (e.g. image dimensions, maximum file size, allowed formats)?
FileAndMediaContent.resume_file_uploads: Do you need to support file uploads for resumes or attachments (e.g., PDF, Word), in addition to form-based resume submission?
FileAndMediaContent.rss_item_content_scope: Besides title, summary, and publication time, should any other RSS item elements be supported (e.g. author, full content, images, categories)?
FileAndMediaContent.scenic_spot_media_support: Do you need support for uploading and displaying images or other media for scenic spots (e.g., photo galleries)?
FileAndMediaContent.service_description_content: What specific service information should be shown on the landing page (e.g. overview, pricing, duration, benefits, FAQs)?
FileAndMediaContent.stored_file_metadata: What metadata about each uploaded file should be stored and displayed (e.g. name, size, type, upload date, uploader, description)?
FileAndMediaContent.story_and_illustration_structure: How should the story text and pictures be structured together (e.g. picture per page of text, picture above/below text, or separate gallery)?
FileAndMediaContent.supported_media_types: Which formats and aspect ratios of videos and images should be prioritized for the entrepreneurship content on the page?
FileAndMediaContent.teaching_resource_formats: What types of files or media (e.g. PDFs, videos, images, links) should be supported for teaching resource sharing and homework attachments?
FileAndMediaContent.technical_document_library: Do you need a browsable library of technical documents with categorization and versioning beyond per-request attachments?
FileAndMediaContent.tool_package_versions: Should the website host multiple versions of the tool package (e.g. stable, beta, historical releases)?
FileAndMediaContent.types_of_design_resources: Which types of design resources should be provided for download (e.g. Figma, Sketch, PNG/SVG icon sets, asset bundles)?
FileAndMediaContent.video_content_scope: What kinds of videos will be displayed and evaluated (e.g. live streams, recorded clips) and how are they associated with stores or factories?
FileAndMediaContent.video_formats_and_resolutions: Which video formats and resolutions should be supported and stored for the library (e.g., MP4 1080p/720p/480p)?

InformationArchitecture.api_management_structure: Should APIs be organized into groups, services, or environments (e.g. dev/test/prod) within the backend information architecture?
InformationArchitecture.browsing_structure_for_tea_information: How should tea culture information be organized for browsing (e.g. by tea type, health effects, taboos, articles, FAQs)?
InformationArchitecture.category_and_tag_structure: How should blog categories and tags be structured and organized for filtering (e.g., hierarchical categories, free-form tags)?
InformationArchitecture.certificate_page_layout_consistency: Which sections and field order should every certificate detail page consistently include (e.g., image at top, then name, description, related content)?
InformationArchitecture.content_categorization: How should news and business service information be categorized (e.g., by policy type, audience, date, or announcement vs notice)?
InformationArchitecture.content_consistency_across_pages: Should the three pages follow a consistent layout structure for titles and introductions, or can each page have a distinct layout?
InformationArchitecture.content_grouping_and_labels: How should exhibition information, exhibitor directory, audience services, news, schedules, transportation guides, and materials be grouped and labeled so users can easily find them?
InformationArchitecture.content_grouping_for_families: How should content be grouped so it is easy for families to access (e.g. by age group, themes, or story chapters)?
InformationArchitecture.content_grouping_strategy: How should community content and mall products be grouped or categorized to make them easy to find?
InformationArchitecture.content_grouping_structure: How should government affairs information be grouped and structured (e.g. by institution, level of government, topic areas, or user tasks)?
InformationArchitecture.content_hierarchy_for_brand_recognition: How should information be structured across pages to improve user experience and brand recognition (e.g. grouping content by audience, task, or product lines)?
InformationArchitecture.data_category_structure: How should the data be organized into sections or categories (e.g. by business function, by time period, by user segment)?
InformationArchitecture.feature_presentation_layout: How should framework features and advantages be organized and presented (e.g., grouped by category, feature list vs detailed pages)?
InformationArchitecture.grouping_of_health_info_and_reports: How should health information and reports be organized (e.g. by date, department, report type, institution)?
InformationArchitecture.information_priority_and_layout: Which company details should be visually prioritized on the digital name card (e.g. logo and name first, then address and contact methods) and how should they be grouped?
InformationArchitecture.information_sections_for_browsing: What categories of related information should be organized for users to browse (e.g. announcements, notices, fee explanations, community news)?
InformationArchitecture.landing_page_sections: Which main sections should the landing page include around the scheduling feature (e.g. hero, service details, testimonials, FAQ, call-to-action)?
InformationArchitecture.module_grouping_and_labels: How should the visualization modules be grouped and labeled to reflect employment, learning progress, and population change themes?
InformationArchitecture.module_information_structure: How should information be organized across modules so that related data for goods flow, capital flow, and information flow is easily accessible and cross-linked?
InformationArchitecture.page_content_layout: How should the title, brief introduction, and main content be arranged on each page (e.g. heading, intro paragraph, then body sections)?
InformationArchitecture.page_hierarchy_for_certificates: What overall page hierarchy should the site use for the 7 certificates and their related sub-pages (e.g., one main certificates page with child detail pages and further sub-pages)?
InformationArchitecture.product_catalog_structure: How should the eSIM catalog be structured (e.g. by region, carrier, use case such as travel vs local)?
InformationArchitecture.public_vs_private_content: Which parts of scenic spot and user information should be publicly visible without login, and which should require authentication?
InformationArchitecture.service_section_structure: Should storage, delivery, and authenticity information be grouped under a single 'Services' section or separated into different sections in the navigation?
InformationArchitecture.toy_categorization: Should toys be organized into explicit categories or collections (e.g. by type, theme, age group) for browsing?
InformationArchitecture.user_type_information_hierarchy: Should the information architecture separate views for merchants/employees versus end-users, or share common pages with role-based content differences?
InformationArchitecture.wine_category_structure: How should white wines be categorized in the site structure (e.g. by grape type, region, style, price tiers)?

RecordsAndOutcomes.activity_history_retention: How long should recorded user activities and alerts be retained and should there be limits or archiving rules?
RecordsAndOutcomes.admin_audit_trails: Do you need audit logs of admin actions on user accounts, funds, and portfolios?
RecordsAndOutcomes.alarm_history_records: Do you need persistent records of alarms with status (new/acknowledged/resolved), timestamps, and handling logs?
RecordsAndOutcomes.alert_and_incident_history: Do you need a history of alerts, incidents, and automated remediation actions with timestamps and responsible users?
RecordsAndOutcomes.alert_delivery_channels: How should data alerts be delivered to users (e.g. in-app notifications, email, SMS)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.alert_history_records: Should the system maintain a searchable history of past security alerts with resolution status and timestamps?
RecordsAndOutcomes.analysis_history_and_storage: Should the system store historical analyses and reports per user for later viewing, and if so, for how long and with what ability to export or delete them?
RecordsAndOutcomes.api_change_history: Do you need to keep history or versioning of API changes so users can view previous configurations or roll back?
RecordsAndOutcomes.application_status_tracking: Which statuses and timestamps should be stored and visible for each application (e.g. submitted, under_review, approved, rejected, completed)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.appointment_history_view: Should users be able to see a history of past and upcoming appointments with status (completed, canceled, no-show)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.appointment_record_details: What data should be stored and shown in appointment records (e.g., status, timestamps, teacher, student, course, evaluation status, reminders sent)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.archival_structure: How should archived reports be structured and organized (e.g. by project, construction site, time period, or material category)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.audit_and_deployment_history: Should the platform keep a history of audit results and deployment actions for each script, including timestamps and responsible users?
RecordsAndOutcomes.audit_trails_and_review_records: What level of audit logging is required for actions like approvals, financial adjustments, and collections steps, and who should be able to review these logs?
RecordsAndOutcomes.authenticity_verification_records: Should the system store and display records of authenticity checks for each bottle or product batch?
RecordsAndOutcomes.authorization_history_visibility: Do you need to show users a history of past authorizations and changes (e.g. previous expirations, renewals, rejections)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.authorization_status_display: How should authorization records be displayed (e.g. table or cards) and which fields beyond status and expiration time should be shown?
RecordsAndOutcomes.availability_and_uptime_records: Should the platform store long-term records of availability, failover events, and SLA compliance for the managed databases and big data services?
RecordsAndOutcomes.browsing_history_scope: How long and in what form should users’ product browsing history be stored and displayed in the personal center?
RecordsAndOutcomes.collection_progress_tracking: What specific progress indicators and outcome statuses (e.g. contacted, promise to pay, partially paid, fully recovered, written off) should be tracked for each plan?
RecordsAndOutcomes.commission_history_records: Should the system keep a detailed history of commission calculations and payouts per order and per user, and for how long?
RecordsAndOutcomes.consultation_history_and_records: Which details should be stored and shown in consultation records (e.g. date, doctor, discussion summary, prescriptions, attachments)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.contract_and_agreement_records: Should the system store versioned records of all signed contracts and key outcomes (e.g. approvals, rejections, restructures, write-offs) and make them viewable to users and admins?
RecordsAndOutcomes.conversion_history_records: Should the system keep a history of each conversion run with status, timestamps, and summary statistics for users to review later?
RecordsAndOutcomes.course_record_lifecycle: Should past courses and their appointments remain visible as historical records, and for how long?
RecordsAndOutcomes.creator_revenue_records: What level of detail should be shown in content creators' revenue records (e.g. per-subscriber, per-content, fees and payouts)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.data_history_and_audit: Do you need to keep history and audit trails of changes to environmental records (who edited what and when)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.document_review_records: Should the system keep a history of document review outcomes (status changes, reviewer, timestamps, comments) for auditing and tracking?
RecordsAndOutcomes.donation_records: Should the app keep a donation history record per user and allow them to view past donations and receipts?
RecordsAndOutcomes.error_and_warning_severity_levels: Do you need to classify audit findings into severity levels (e.g., error, warning, info) that affect whether a script can be deployed?
RecordsAndOutcomes.event_detail_level: What details should be stored for each monitored event (e.g. timestamp, user ID, IP address, URL, action type, metadata)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.execution_history_records: Do you need to keep a history of script executions with their outcomes (e.g., timestamp, user, status, logs)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.execution_results_persistence: Should Lua script execution results be stored as records for later review, and if so, what details need to be captured (e.g. input parameters, output, status, timestamps, errors)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.experiment_history_and_logs: Should the system keep a history of past experiments per user, including parameters used and recorded results, for later review or comparison?
RecordsAndOutcomes.experiment_result_presentation: In what format should experiment results be presented to users (e.g., images, graphs, numerical data tables, step-by-step outcome summaries)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.favorites_persistence: Should favorites and reading history be stored only per user account in the cloud, or also cached locally for quick access?
RecordsAndOutcomes.game_progress_records: Do you need to store historical records of game progress or results per user or per session?
RecordsAndOutcomes.grade_history_and_visibility: Should the app maintain a historical record of grades per student and per course, and who should be able to view these records?
RecordsAndOutcomes.help_records_management: What details should be stored and visible in help records (e.g., requester, helpers, timestamps, location, status, outcome notes), and who should be able to view them?
RecordsAndOutcomes.historical_data_retention: How long should historical satellite IoT data and configuration changes be retained, and do you need version history for records?
RecordsAndOutcomes.history_and_records: Do you need to keep version history or audit logs of changes made to business data records?
RecordsAndOutcomes.history_record_scope: What types of events should appear in elevator history records (maintenance, repair, rescue, inspections, alarms, regulatory actions)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.inspection_record_lifecycle: How long should self-inspection and supervision records be retained, and do you need explicit states such as draft, submitted, under review, rectifying, and closed?
RecordsAndOutcomes.inventory_snapshot_needs: Do you need periodic inventory snapshots or only real-time computed inventory based on operation records?
RecordsAndOutcomes.investment_records_detail_level: What details should each investment record show to the user (e.g. timestamps, product name, amount, status, returns realized, transaction IDs)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.job_and_deployment_history: Should the system keep historical records of data development jobs, deployments, and their outcomes for auditing and troubleshooting?
RecordsAndOutcomes.job_run_history: Should the system keep a history of scheduling runs and their outcomes, and if so for how long and with what level of detail?
RecordsAndOutcomes.learning_record_scope: Which types of learning records should be tracked for each user (e.g. course completion, time spent, assessment scores, recommendation history)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.message_history_retention: Should the system retain a history of messages and administrator replies for each user, and for how long should these records be kept?
RecordsAndOutcomes.message_history_scope: How long and with what level of detail should message history be retained and displayed (e.g. all messages, last N, with full metadata or summary only)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.message_history_view: Do you need a message history view where users can scroll back through older messages per channel?
RecordsAndOutcomes.message_persistence: Should messages be stored persistently for later retrieval or is the messaging intended to be ephemeral only while users are connected?

RecordsAndOutcomes.order_history_access: Should users or admins be able to view order history and status over time?

RecordsAndOutcomes.order_history_for_users: Should users have full access to historical orders with filters by time/status and any export or download capability?
RecordsAndOutcomes.order_history_in_user_center: What details should be visible in the user center for each order record (e.g. items, amounts, timestamps, status, payment method)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.order_history_records: Should users have access to their own order history including purchased wines, storage usage, and deliveries?
RecordsAndOutcomes.order_history_retention: How long should order and payment records be retained and should users and merchants always be able to view full history?
RecordsAndOutcomes.order_history_scope: Should order history include both reservations and merchandise purchases with statuses (e.g., upcoming, completed, canceled, refunded)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.order_history_visibility: Should users be able to view a full history of status changes and edits for each sales order?
RecordsAndOutcomes.order_information_detail_level: What details should be visible in order records to users and admins (e.g. shipment tracking, payment breakdown, buyer and seller info)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.order_record_details: What specific fields and statuses should be stored and displayed for payment orders and refund orders?
RecordsAndOutcomes.order_records_for_merchants: Should merchants be able to view and filter historical order records for reconciliation and operations?
RecordsAndOutcomes.order_tracking_history: Do you need to store historical status changes for each order (e.g. created, paid, shipped, completed, refunded)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.payment_history_and_audit_trail: Do you need a detailed audit trail recording who generated links, when payments were authorized or captured, and any subsequent changes to security deposit records?
RecordsAndOutcomes.payment_status_tracking: Which payment statuses and outcomes (e.g. authorized, captured, failed, refunded, expired) should be stored and visible in the system for each security deposit?
RecordsAndOutcomes.performance_reports_history: Do you need historical performance reports or logs so users can compare past and current database performance and track the impact of optimization changes?
RecordsAndOutcomes.personal_consumption_record_fields: What data fields should be shown in personal consumption records (e.g. date, merchant name, amount, city, bank, reward information)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.personal_information_fields: Which personal information fields should be viewable and editable in the personal center (e.g. name, avatar, phone, address)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.points_transaction_history: Should users be able to view a history of point accruals and redemptions, and at what level of detail?
RecordsAndOutcomes.portfolio_performance_metrics: Which portfolio metrics should be tracked and displayed (e.g. total P&L, daily P&L, return percentage, cost basis)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.publishing_history_and_audit: Do you need to keep an audit trail of article edits and publishing actions (who changed what and when, including terminal-specific publish logs)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.quantity_and_material_output_format: In what formats should engineering quantities and material lists be output (e.g., on-screen tables, Excel export, PDF reports)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.query_result_handling: Should users be able to export query results (e.g. to CSV/Excel) and view pagination for large result sets?
RecordsAndOutcomes.reading_history_scope: What details should be stored in reading history (e.g., last read chapter and page, timestamps, device)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.reconciliation_records: What information should reconciliation records include to support financial management (e.g., totals, fees, discrepancies, settlement dates)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.record_versioning: Do you need version history or change tracking for records edited through the admin panel?
RecordsAndOutcomes.referral_activity_records: Should users see a history of referral activity and rewards, and if so which fields should be included (e.g. referred user, date joined, reward amount, status)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.regulatory_audit_trail: Do you need a complete audit trail of actions and outcomes for use by regulators during inspections or audits?
RecordsAndOutcomes.report_export_formats: Do you need reports to be exportable, and if so, in which formats (e.g. PDF, Excel, CSV, image)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.report_generation: What kinds of data reports should users be able to view or generate (e.g. sales summaries, performance by product, custom reports)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.report_history_and_archiving: Should generated reports be stored for later access with metadata such as creator, time range, and creation date?
RecordsAndOutcomes.report_storage_and_history: Do you need to store past analysis reports so users can reopen or download them later?
RecordsAndOutcomes.resource_usage_history: Do you need to keep and display historical records of resource release and access linked to applications and reviews?
RecordsAndOutcomes.results_persistence: Should the system keep historical records of past tournaments, matches, and rankings for later viewing and statistics?
RecordsAndOutcomes.retention_of_activity_history: How long should app usage, location, camera/microphone, and file access histories be retained and visible to parents?
RecordsAndOutcomes.return_and_after_sales_records: What information about returns and after-sales cases should be recorded (e.g. reason, evidence, timeline, resolution outcome)?

RecordsAndOutcomes.score_visibility: Should users be able to view only their own scores or also aggregate statistics such as averages or rankings?
RecordsAndOutcomes.service_records_retention: How long should users be able to view their past service records on the website?
RecordsAndOutcomes.service_records_scope: What details should service records include for users (e.g. date, location, vehicle, services, price, payment status, hardware activation logs)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.subscription_history_records: How detailed should users’ subscription records be (e.g. plan, start/end dates, renewals, payment status, refunds)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.suggestion_history_and_status: Should users be able to view a history and status of their submitted suggestions (e.g. received, under review, responded)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.support_case_history: Should the system keep a history of past support requests and their resolutions that users can review later?
RecordsAndOutcomes.system_information_scope: Which types of system information should be browsable (e.g. version info, service status, usage stats)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.system_logs_detail_level: What level of detail should system logs capture and display (e.g. login attempts, configuration changes, permission updates)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.test_history_tracking: Should the system keep a full history of executions per test case and per hardware product to compare results across runs and versions?
RecordsAndOutcomes.test_result_record_structure: What information should each stored test result record contain (e.g. status, timestamps, logs, measurements, tester, environment, linked defects)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.time_range_for_records: Should users be able to select a time range for their consumption records and corresponding rankings within the activity period?
RecordsAndOutcomes.tip_submission_history: Do you need users to see a history or status of their submitted news tips (e.g. received, under review, published)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.trading_history_details: What details should be stored and shown in trading history (e.g. execution time, price, fees, order type, status)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.trajectory_history_retention: For how long should historical trajectory records be stored, and should users be able to export trajectory data for analysis or compliance?
RecordsAndOutcomes.transaction_history_records: Should the platform keep detailed history records for orders, recharges, withdrawals, point changes, and coupon usage visible to users?
RecordsAndOutcomes.transaction_history_retention: How long should recharge, earning, and withdrawal records be retained and visible to users?
RecordsAndOutcomes.transaction_history_scope: How long should transaction records be retained and should admins be able to export or download them?
RecordsAndOutcomes.transaction_history_visibility: Do you need users to view detailed transaction history and outcomes for transfers and payments within the app?
RecordsAndOutcomes.transaction_record_details: Which fields should be shown in transaction records (e.g. client, amount, currency, payment gateway, status, timestamps, reference IDs)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.unmatched_data_handling: How should unmatched data be presented and handled (e.g., separate list, export option, or follow-up actions)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.update_history_details: What details should be stored and shown in update history records (e.g. old vs new values, user who made the change, timestamp, related WhatsApp messages)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.user_account_history: Should user accounts keep a history of viewed items, purchases, and financial transactions related to art trading?
RecordsAndOutcomes.user_activity_record_scope: Should user activity records on this page include only task completion and rewards, or also timestamps and streak/attendance information?
RecordsAndOutcomes.user_behavior_log_retention: How long should user behavior logs be retained and at what level of detail (session-level, event-level, aggregated)?
RecordsAndOutcomes.versioning_of_generated_results: Should different versions of generated construction drawings and quantity/material results be stored and comparable over time?
RecordsAndOutcomes.warning_handling_records: Should the system keep a history of each warning’s handling outcome and timestamps for audit and tracking purposes?
RecordsAndOutcomes.work_report_contents: Which details should be included in work reports beyond cost savings and efficiency (e.g. task counts, downtime reduction, compliance status, customer satisfaction)?

ColorSchemeAndComponents.typography_and_basic_styles: Do you need specific font choices, text sizes, or basic styling (e.g. spacing, alignment) to match the pale green and forest green color scheme?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_block_background_color: Should all primary UI blocks or cards use burlywood as their background color, and should success/error/loading states alter this color?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_block_color: Should UI blocks (panels, cards, dialogs) consistently use dark slate gray as their background color with contrasting text?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_block_color_usage: Which specific UI blocks in the header (e.g., menu items, logo area, dropdowns) should use peru as their background or accent color?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_component_color_scheme: Should olive be consistently applied to primary UI components (e.g. buttons, headers, navigation) as the main accent color?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_component_color_usage: Which UI components should use indian red (e.g. buttons, headers, borders, icons) and should there be hover/active color variations?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_component_primary_color: Should coral be applied as the primary color for all UI components such as buttons, cards, navigation bars, and input borders?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_components_color_scheme: Should all UI components (buttons, lists, sliders, controls) consistently use dark khaki as their primary color, including hover and active states?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_components_primary_color: Should crimson be applied to all UI components (e.g. buttons, controls, navigation elements) as their primary color?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_element_color_mapping: Which UI components (e.g. navigation bar, buttons, table headers, input fields) should use the peru color for UI elements?
ColorSchemeAndComponents.ui_elements_color_scheme: Should primary UI elements (buttons, headers, key icons) consistently use the chocolate color, and do you need any secondary accent colors?
